BY SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THEIR DEGREES, AS WELL AS THE PLANNED TRAINING AND JOB-SHADOWING ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS PROJECT, STUDENTS WILL BE WELL SITUATED FOR SUCCESS IN THE WORKFORCE.IN YEAR 1, WE WILL ENGAGE IN EXTENSIVE RECRUITING EFFORTS. IN YEAR 2 WE WILL TOUR EASTERN OREGON TO VISIT WITH STAKEHOLDERS. THROUGH DISCIPLINARY TRAINING (FELLOWSHIP-FUNDED) AND JOINT INTERDISCIPLINARY ACTIVITIES (IRTA-FUNDED), STUDENTS WILL GAIN SKILLS IN MAKING SCIENCE USEFUL TO COLLABORATIVE ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITIES, AND POLICY MAKERS. EXTENSION FORESTERS WILL PROVIDE OFF-CAMPUS MENTORING, JOB SHADOWING, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO COLLABORATE WITH SPECIALISTS AND THE PUBLIC SECTOR. IN YEAR 3, STUDENTS WILL PRODUCE A PROBLEM-FOCUSED EXTENSION PRODUCT FOR USE IN LAND MANAGEMENT, AND WORK TOWARDS PEER-REVIEWED PUBLICATIONS FROM THEIR RESEARCH. BY GRADUATING AT LEAST ONE WOMAN AND ONE STUDENT FROMAN UNDERREPRESENTED GROUP, WE WILL HAVE A MEASURABLE IMPACT IN THE FORESTRY TESA.

THE U.S. FACES A CRITICAL SHORTAGE OF PROFESSIONALS WITH THE TRAINING TO COMBAT MAJOR GLOBAL HEALTH SECURITY PRIORITIES, INCLUDING ZOONOTIC AND FOREIGN ANIMAL DISEASES, FOOD PROTECTION, AGROTERRORISM, AND ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE. THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY IS WELL POSITIONED TO HELP BUILD THE NEXT GENERATION WORKFORCE CAPABLE OF ADDRESSING THESE PRIORITIES. THROUGH THE PROPOSED TRAINING PROGRAM, OUR GOAL IS THE PRODUCTION OF THREE VETERINARY PROFESSIONALS WITH ADVANCED TECHNICAL TRAINING IN AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY AND THE PROFICIENCY TO SHARE THEIR EXPERTISE WITH THE SECTORS INVOLVED IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BIOSECURITY MEASURES. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL, WE WILL DELIVER A RIGOROUS, THREE-YEAR POST-DOCTORAL TRAINING PROGRAM (FELLOWSHIP) THAT CULMINATES IN A MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH DEGREE AND ELIGIBILTY FOR NATIONAL BOARD CERTIFICATION IN VETERINARY PREVENTIVE MEDICINE. FELLOWS WILL DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT SCENARIO-BASED ANIMAL DISEASE OUTBREAK TRAINING EXERCISES THAT SIMULATE RELEVANT FIELD CONDITIONS AND STAKEHOLDER PRIORITIES. PARTICIPANTS OF THE TRAINING EXERCISES WILL REPRESENT DIVERSE AGENCIES INVOLVED WITH THE PROTECTION OF AGRICULTURAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, USDA, AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE SERVICES. OUR PROPOSAL DIRECTLY ADDRESSES THE MAIN GOAL OF THE NATIONAL NEEDS FELLOWSHIP GRANT PROGRAM: TO PROMOTE ADVANCES IN U.S. FOOD, AGRICULTURAL, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND HUMAN SCIENCES THROUGH THE TRAINING OF NEW STUDENTS, TO FILL NATIONALLY IDENTIFIED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREAS. ADDITIONALLY, BY REQUIRING OUR FELLOWS TO ENGAGE WITH MULTI-SECTORAL AND MULTI-DISCIPLINARY NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL STAKEHOLDERS, FELLOWS WILL CULTIVATE LEADERSHIP, MANAGEMENT, AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS. THE FELLOWSHIP WILL GENERATE GLOBAL LEADERS IN THE AGRICULTURE SECTOR, BECAUSE A HEALTH THREAT ANYWHERE IS A HEALTH THREAT EVERYWHERE.

THE FIELD OF DATA SCIENCE IS BLOSSOMING IN PARALLEL TO A PROLIFERATION OF DATA STREAMS ON FOOD, AGRICULTURE, NUTRITION, HEALTH, AND SUSTAINABILITY. DATA SCIENCE OFFERS A FRAMEWORK OF ANALYTICAL SKILLS TO LINK, MANAGE, MAP, ANALYZE, INTERPRET, AND DISPLAY DATA, AS WELL AS TO COMMUNICATE THEIR FINDINGS TO DIVERSE AUDIENCES. TO ADDRESS THE TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA (TESA) OF DATA SCIENCE, WE WILL TRAIN THREE PH.D. FELLOWS WHO GAIN EXPERTISE IN DATA ANALYTICS, DATA VISUALIZATION AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION AS WELL AS TRAINING IN ONE OF THREE OF FOCAL DISCIPLINES AND THEMES: HEALTHY FOOD CHOICES, FOOD SAFETY AND QUALITY, AND SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE. OUR PROGRAM IS ALIGNED WITH TWO FARM BILL PRIORITY AREAS AND SEVERAL STRATEGIC GOALS FROM THE USDA STRATEGIC PLAN FY2014-2018, USDA-NIFA CHALLENGE AREAS, AND NIFA SUB-GOALS 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, AND 1.7. THE DEMAND FOR EXPERTS IN DATA SCIENCE, CAPABLE TO EFFECTIVELY UTILIZE DATA AND INTEGRATE NEW ANALYTICAL APPROACHES TO FURTHER FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ENTERPRISES, IS GROWING. THE LARGE POOL OF POTENTIAL PH.D. STUDENTS COMBINED WITH THE MISSION OF OUR DATA SCIENCE PROGRAM ALLOWS US TO ATTRACT AND RETAIN UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY APPLICANTS. WE WILL MAKE FELLOWS' WORK A FOCAL POINT OF THE ANNUAL STUDENT-LED NUTRITION DATA SCIENCE SUMMIT AND THE NUTRITION COMMUNITY. WE PROPOSE A NEW TRANSFORMATIVE FRAMEWORK TO TRAIN LEADERS WHO: HARNESS THE DATA CYCLE, THINK CRITICALLY IN CONDUCTING DATA ANALYTICS, SUPPORT THE CRAFT OF TEAMWORK WITHOUT JEOPARDIZING INDIVIDUAL CREATIVITY, AND SUPPORT DIALOGUE AND WELL-PRESENTED ARGUMENTS WITHOUT LOSING FOCUS ON ACTIONABLE SOLUTIONS AND ETHICAL ASPECTS OF DATA LIFE CYCLE.

METABOLOMICS IS THE COMPREHENSIVE STUDY OF ALL SMALL MOLECULES (I.E. METABOLITES) WITHIN A BIOLOGICAL SYSTEM. THE ANALYSIS OF THOUSANDS OF METABOLITES AT ONCE PROVIDES A FUNCTIONAL READOUT OF A SYSTEM, PROVIDING VALUABLE BIOCHEMICAL INFORMATION. NEW IN ITS APPLICATION IN AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES, METABOLOMICS HAS WIDESPREAD UTILITY AND REQUIRES THE INTEGRATION OF ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, BIOCHEMISTRY, AND DATA ANALYSIS FOR A SYSTEMS-WIDE VIEW. THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY IS POISED TO TRAIN STUDENTS IN THIS EMERGING, HIGHLY RELEVANT AREA. WE PROPOSE METABOLOMICS ACROSS THE FOOD SYSTEM: AN INTEGRATED GRADUATE TRAINING PROGRAM TO FILL CRITICAL NEEDS IN FOOD SCIENCE, HUMAN SCIENCES, AND HUMAN NUTRITION TESA (DISCIPLINES BIOTECHNOLOGY, BIOCHEMISTRY AND MICROBIOLOGY (B) FOOD SCIENCE (F), HUMAN NUTRITION (N), AND PLANT SCIENCES (P)). OUR PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO TRAIN AN INTERDISCIPLINARY AND DIVERSE GRADUATE COHORT WITH SKILLS IN METABOLOMICS AS IT RELATES TO PLANTS, FOODS, AND NUTRITION. PROJECT DIRECTOR JESSICA COOPERSTONE, AND CO-DIRECTORS EMMANUEL HATZAKIS, RACHEL KOPEC AND DEVIN PETERSON HAVE SKILLS IN METABOLOMICS ACROSS THE PLANT-FOOD-NUTRITION SPACE TO TRAIN FUTURE LEADERS FOR INDUSTRY, GOVERNMENT, ACADEMIC, AND NONPROFIT JOBS. WE WILL TRAIN THREE DOCTORAL STUDENTS FOR THREE YEARS, AND ONE MASTER'S STUDENT FOR TWO YEARS. EACH OF OUR FELLOWS WILL DISPLAY COMPETENCIES IN: DESIGNING, CONDUCTING, AND ANALYZING RESEARCH IN FOOD- AND NUTRITION-RELATED METABOLOMICS, PUTTING FINDINGS INTO BROADER CONTEXT, AND COMMUNICATING SCIENTIFIC FINDINGS TO ACADEMICS AND THE PUBLIC. THIS PROGRAM AFFORDS TRAINEES SKILLS NEEDED TO SOLVE FUTURE GRAND CHALLENGES AND INCREASE HUMAN RESOURCE DIVERSITY IN THE AGRICULTURAL ENTERPRISE, WHILE PROVIDING ALL AMERICANS A SAFE AND NUTRITIOUS FOOD SUPPLY.

PLANT DISEASES ARE A SIGNIFICANT THREAT TO GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY.GIVEN THAT CLIMATE VARIABILITY IS LEADING TO NEWLY EMERGING DISEASES, CROP LOSS DUE TO PLANT DISEASE IS POISED TO BECOME ONE OF THE BIGGEST CROP PRODUCTION PROBLEMS OF THIS CENTURY. BOTH MOLECULAR AND FIELD-SCALE APPROACHES FOR DISEASE MANAGEMENT ARE CRITICAL TO MAKING GAINS IN PLANT PRODUCTION. NEW GENOMIC AND PHENOMIC TOOLS DEMAND THAT PLANT PATHOLOGISTS HAVE A STRONG FOUNDATION IN QUANTITATIVE SKILLS, INCLUDING BIG DATA AND IMAGE ANALYSIS.BECAUSE OF THE MULTIPLE SCALES AND CROSS-DISCIPLINARY NATURE OF PLANT PATHOLOGY, SCIENTISTS TRAINED IN MOLECULAR AND FIELD-SCALE PLANT PATHOLOGY WHO CAN INTEGRATE THIS KNOWLEDGE WITH QUANTITATIVE APPROACHES ARE NEEDED. IN THIS NATIONAL NEEDS FELLOWSHIP PROPOSAL, WE WILL DEVELOP A NEW DOCTORAL TRAINING PROGRAM THAT WILL TRAIN SIX PHD FELLOWS TO SOLVE PLANT DISEASE PROBLEMS BY OFFERING UNIQUE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES FROM MOLECULAR TO FIELD PLANT PATHOLOGY INTEGRATED WITH CROSS-DISCIPLINARY TRAINING IN QUANTITATIVE SCIENCES. SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY NUMBER OF DOCTORAL DEGREES AWARDED, QUALITY OF RESEARCH, AND JOB PLACEMENT IN ACADEMIA, INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE: 1) DEVELOP A NEW DOCTORAL PROGRAM THAT WILL TRAIN SIX PHD NATIONAL NEEDS FELLOWS WITHIN THE TESA OF PLANT PRODUCTION, AND PROVIDE CROSS-DISCIPLINARY TRAINING IN COMPUTATIONAL AND QUANTIATIVE BIOLOGY, 2) PROVIDE RESEARCH AND TEACHING OPPORTUNITIES IN THE TESA FROM MOLECULAR TO FIELD SCALES, 3) PROVIDE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH INNOVATIVE INTERNSHIPS IN EXTENSION, INDUSTRY, AND PURDUE'S PLANT AND PEST DIAGNOSTIC LABORATORY, 4) PREPARE STUDENTS FOR JOBS IN THE TESA. ?

CAREERS IN EXTENSION PROVIDE IMPACTFUL AND STABLE POST-GRADUATION EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR M.S. STUDENTS IN AGRICULTURE AND HORTICULTURE. TO BE SUCCESSFUL, CANDIDATES FOR THESE POSITIONS REQUIRE BOTH TECHNICAL SCIENCE BACKGROUNDS AND STRONG COMMUNICATION SKILLS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF A DIVERSE VARIETY OF AUDIENCES. IN UTAH, AND ACROSS THE US, THE DEMAND FOR SUITABLE CANDIDATES IS COMPOUNDED. IN UTAH, 40% OF THE UTAH STATE UNIVERSITY EXTENSION WORKFORCE WILL BE ELIGIBLE TO RETIRE WITHIN TEN YEARS. ONE CHALLENGE FACED IN RECENT SEARCH COMMITTEES FOR EXTENSION EDUCATORS WAS FINDING CANDIDATES WITH BOTH KNOWLEDGE OF AGRICULTURE AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION SKILLS (ORAL AND WRITING). THEREFORE, THE PRIMARY GOAL OF STEPSS IS TO TRAIN SIX NNF FELLOWS AT THE MASTERS OF SCIENCE DEGREE LEVEL TO PROVIDE NEXT GENERATION LEADERS IN EXTENSION, SPECIFICALLY WITHIN THE PLANT PRODUCTION TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA (TESA). NNF FELLOWS WILL APPLY CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH FOR HIGH-VALUE CROP PRODUCTION. OUR TRAINING WILL HELP THE NNF FELLOW LEARN SKILLS IN AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGY (ENVIRONMENTAL SENSORS, HORTICULTURAL INFRASTRUCTURE, CROP MODELING, ETC.); DATA COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND MANAGEMENT; PROGRAMMING (WORKSHOPS, FIELD DAYS) AND GRANT WRITING, AND IMPROVE THEIR ORAL AND WRITTEN INFORMATION PROFICIENCY. THE FELLOWS WILL BE MENTORED TO REACH DIVERSE AUDIENCES INCLUDING THE GENERAL PUBLIC, INDIVIDUAL FARMERS AND GROWER ASSOCIATIONS, EXTENSION AGENTS, AND ACADEMIC SCIENTISTS. NNF FELLOWS WILL HAVE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES TO PRESENT THEIR RESEARCH, ORGANIZE FIELD EVENTS, USE SOCIAL MEDIA TECHNOLOGY, AND CO-AUTHOR BOTH PEER-REVIEWED RESEARCH PAPERS AND EXTENSION FACT SHEETS. THE STRENGTH OF STEPSS IS BASED ON THE WELL-ROUNDED OPPORTUNITIES THAT BRIDGE RESEARCH AND EXTENSION, AND THE HIGH POST-GRADUATION DEMAND FOR THIS TRAINING.

WE TARGET THE EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA OF FOREST RESOURCES AND THE DISCIPLINES OF CONSERVATION ANDRENEWABLE NATURAL RESOURCES. WE SEEK SUPPORT TO RECRUIT, EDUCATE, AND GRADUATE THREE PH.D.FELLOWS FROM UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY GROUPS. WE PROPOSE A GRADUATE FELLOWSHIP PROJECT INFOREST RESOURCES FOCUSING ON BULLARD ET AL.'S SIX CORE COMPETENCIES FOR WORKFORCE-READYRESEARCHERS AND PRACTITIONERS: MANAGING FOREST RESOURCES; CRITICAL THINKING; COMMUNICATING AND COLLABORATING;MANAGING SELF; LEADERSHIP; AND TRANSFORMATIVE LEADERSHIP AND LEARNING. OUR PROGRAM IS FRAMED TOOFFER A PATHWAY TO LONG-TERM, IMPACTFUL CAREERS IN FOREST RESOURCES. GRADUATE TRAININGENCOMPASSES COMPREHENSIVE COURSEWORK INTERWOVEN WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO CULTIVATE LEADERSHIPSKILLS THROUGH INSTRUCTION, PROFESSIONAL INTERNSHIPS AND OUTREACH INITIATIVES IN OUR LOCALCOMMUNITY AND PROFESSIONAL SOCIETIES. SPECIFICALLY, ELEMENTS INCLUDE: (A) TARGETED RECRUITING AT1890 LAND GRANT UNIVERSITIES AND HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES ANDUNIVERSITIES; (B) INSTRUCTIONALAND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN CONTEMPORARY FOREST ECOLOGY, MANAGEMEN; AND POLICY; (C) ACADEMIC,PROFESSIONAL, AND PEER MENTORING TAILORED TO UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS; (D) A PROFESSIONALINTERNSHIP WITH A FOREST RESOURCES COMPANY, A STATE OR FEDERAL AGENCY, OR A NON-PROFIT PROJECTPARTNER; (E) OPPORTUNITIES FOR LEADERSHIP AND TEACHING; AND (F) A COHESIVE AND SUPPORTIVE LEARNINGENVIRONMENT. ACCOMPLISHMENTS WILL BE ASSESSED PERIODICALLY THROUGH FELLOWS' SELF-REPORTEDANNUAL REVIEWS AND PORTFOLIOS. OUR PROPOSED PROJECT ADDRESSES ALL FY2018 NNF OBJECTIVES,INCLUDING THE TRAINING OF NEW STUDENTS IN EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREAS, INCREASING THE NUMBER OFOUTSTANDING STUDENTS FROM TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS, AND INSTILLING HANDS-ON SCIENCECOMPETENCIES. THESE OUTCOMES ALIGN WITH NIFA'S GOALS TO INTEGRATE NATURAL AND HUMAN SCIENCES,RESEARCH, EDUCATION AND EXTENSION AS WELL AS TO PROMOTE COOPERATION AMONG STAKEHOLDERS.

ACROSS THE UNITED STATES EXURBANIZATION IS A PREDOMINANT LAND USE CHANGE, WHICH HAS PROFOUND IMPLICATIONS FOR OUR NATION'S FOREST RESOURCES. EXURBAN DEVELOPMENT IMPACTS ECOLOGICAL FUNCTIONING, AFFECTS THE CHARACTER AND VIABILITY OF THE FORESTRY SECTOR, AND CREATES MYRIAD CHALLENGES FOR FORESTRY PRACTITIONERS SUCH AS SMALL PARCEL MANAGEMENT, CHANGING LANDOWNER ATTITUDES AND OBJECTIVES, AND INCREASED IMPORTANCE OF NON-TRADITIONAL FOREST MANAGEMENT ENTITIES. TO BE SUCCESSFUL AND MEET THE US FORESTRY SECTOR'S CHANGING NEEDS AND EMPLOYER BASE, THE NEXT GENERATION OF FORESTRY PROFESSIONALS WILL REQUIRE INTENSIVE INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING AND KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES THAT MATCH THESE NOVEL LANDSCAPES AND STAKEHOLDER NEEDS.WE WILL DEVELOP AN INTER-DISCIPLINARY MASTER'S LEVEL GRADUATE TRAINING PROGRAM IN EXURBAN FOREST MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING FOCUSED AROUND EXPERIENTIAL SERVICE-LEARNING AND INTENSIVE PREPARATION IN SKILLS ASSOCIATED WITH THE FOLLOWING FOUNDATIONS: 1) EXURBAN FOREST MANAGEMENT, PLANNING, AND POLICY, 2) SOCIO-ECOLOGICAL SYSTEMS THEORY AND APPLICATION, 3) ECOSYSTEM SCIENCE AND MANAGEMENT, AND 4) COMMUNICATION AND ENGAGEMENT THROUGH PROJECT-BASED SERVICE LEARNING. SERVICE LEARNING COURSES WILL DIRECT STUDENTS THROUGH AN EXURBAN FOREST "RESIDENCY" PROGRAM THAT EMBEDS STUDENTS WITHIN PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS FROM RELEVANT EMPLOYMENT SECTORS. OUR GOAL IS TO PROVIDE FUTURE FORESTRY PRACTITIONERS A TRAINING FOUNDATION AND DIRECT EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH CATEGORIES OF POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS IN NOVEL AND EXPANDING SECTORS OF FOREST MANAGEMENT STAKEHOLDERS. WE ANTICIPATE SUCCESSFULLY DIRECTING OUR SIX FELLOWS INTO PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS FOCUSED AROUND MANAGEMENT OF FOREST RESOURCES IN EXURBAN LANDSCAPES, AND EXPECT THAT THIS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE A STRONG BASIS FOR ONGOING EFFORTS TO PREPARE FOREST RESOURCES GRADUATES FOR AN EXURBAN FOREST FUTURE.

WE WILL FOCUS ON THE TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA (TESA) OF DATA SCIENCE TO ADDRESS TWO MACRO TRENDS - THE USE OF MULTIPLE STREAMS OF INFORMATION AND LARGE DATA SETS TO ADDRESS COMPLEX PHENOMENA AND THE SHIFT IN PHILOSOPHY FROM TRADITIONAL EXTENSION TO ENGAGEMENT WITH DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS. OURPROGRAMMATIC GOALS (GOALS 1-2)MEET THE CRITICAL NNF NEED TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN FELLOWS (1 PH.D. AND 3 M.S.) FROM UNDER-REPRESENTED GROUPS AND PROVIDE THEM WITH AN EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING-BASED RESEARCH/ACADEMIC PROGRAM FOCUSED ON DATA SCIENCE FOR SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT PROMOTES INTERDISCIPLINARY SKILLS AND INTELLECTUAL DEVELOPMENT. OURSTUDENT-CENTERED GOALS (GOALS 3-5)WILL AUGMENT EXISTING GRADUATE OFFERINGS TO INCLUDE NEW COURSES AND EMPHASES IN THE NNF AREAS OF DATA SCIENCE, MENTORING AND STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT TO SUPPORT THE STUDY OF SUSTAINABLE AGROECOSYSTEM MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND ENHANCE THE FELLOWS' RESEARCH EXPERIENCES IN USING MULTIPLE DATA STREAMS IN A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ENVIRONMENT THAT ADDRESSES THEIR PERSONAL, SOCIAL AND CAREER NEEDS. OURINSTITUTIONAL GOALS (GOALS 6-7)AIM TO SUSTAINING THE PROGRAM BY CHANGING THE INSTITUTIONAL CULTURE THROUGH INCLUDING FACULTY FROM MULTIPLE DEPARTMENTS, SCIENTISTS FROM GOVERNMENTAL LABORATORIES AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR (SEE LETTERS OF SUPPORT) IN THE REGION, STUDENT PEERS AND PRACTITIONERS AROUND THE WORLD, TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN STUDENTS FROM GROUPS UNDER-REPRESENTED WITH AN INTEREST IN THE APPLICATION OF DATA SCIENCE IN AGROECOSYSTEM SUSTAINABILITY.ALL ACTIVITIES AND OUTCOMES WILL BE EVALUATED BY AN EXTERNAL EVALUATOR IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE PROJECT LEADERSHIP.

THE US SOUTH HAS 245 MILLION ACRES OF FORESTLAND COVERING 46% OF TOTAL LAND USE. THIS REGION IS THE LARGEST WOOD BASKET IN THE WORLD WHERE 60% OF US TIMBER DERIVES LARGELY FROM MANAGED SOFTWOOD PLANTATIONS AND HARDWOOD FORESTS. THESE FOREST SYSTEMS ARE MAJOR ECONOMIC ENGINES TO RURAL ECONOMIES. HOWEVER, NATIONWIDE, FOREST RESOURCES HAS THE LOWEST MINORITY REPRESENTATION WITHIN FOOD, AGRICULTURAL, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND HUMAN SCIENCES AND EVEN LOWER REPRESENTATION IN THE US SOUTH. DIVERSITY ENROLLMENT AND MATRICULATION HAVE FAILED DUE TO POOR INTERSECTIONS OF ACADEMIC SUPPORT, PEER COMMUNITY SUPPORT, MENTORING, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, AND "READINESS" WORK SKILLS. THIS NNF PROGRAM BUILDS ON A PILOT PROGRAM TO PIPELINE MINORITY UNDERGRADUATES FROM HBCUS TO SUCCESSFUL GRADUATE TRAINING IN FOREST RESOURCES AT NC STATE UNIVERSITY (NCSU). THE PROPOSED PROGRAM RECRUITS HBCU UNDERGRADUATES AND OFFERS PRE-ADMISSION MENTORING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR A MASTER'S OF FORESTRY AT NCSU. OUR NNF PROGRAM WILL RECRUIT AND RETAIN FOUR, HIGH-CALIBER MINORITY FORESTRY GRADUATE STUDENTS AND PREPARE THEM FOR MATRICULATION AND PROFESSIONAL SUCCESS THROUGH NNF-SPECIFIC PROGRAMMATIC, CURRICULAR, AND INDUSTRY EXPERIENCES IN FOREST RESOURCES. KEY NNF PROGRAM ELEMENTS ARE A MINORITY MENTORING/LEADERSHIP COMMUNITY (MLC), CERTIFIED FOREST CURRICULUM, AND INDUSTRY INTERNSHIPS IN THE AUTOMATION, ECONOMICS, BIOTECHNOLOGY, AND SCIENCE COMMUNICATION OF FOREST RESOURCES. THE NNF COHORT WILL MENTOR MINORITY UNDERGRADUATES, DISSEMINATE THEIR EXPERIENCES, NETWORK WITH PROFESSIONALS, AND PARTICIPATE IN ANNUAL NNF PROGRAM PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT TO SUPPORT PIPELINE SUSTAINABILITY. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS USDA'S GOAL TO DEVELOP A DIVERSE AND HIGHLY-SKILLED WORKFORCE FOR EMPLOYMENT SHORTAGES IN FOREST RESOURCES.

RATIONALE:THE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION INFORMATION SYSTEM (FAEIS; HTTP://FAIES.USDA.GOV) IS ONE OF THE FEW SOURCES OF UP-TO-DATE, NATIONAL HIGHER EDUCATION DATA FOCUSED ON AGRICULTURE AND AGRICULTURE RELATED PROGRAMS. FAEIS IS A CRITICAL RESOURCE FOR HIGHER EDUCATION ADMINISTRATORS, GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, FACULTY, AND THE USDA TO CONDUCT BENCHMARKING/PEER ANALYSIS, STRATEGIC PLANNING, AND OTHER EFFORTS TO SUPPORT HIGHER EDUCATION IN THE FOOD, HUMAN, AGRICULTURAL, AND NATURAL RESOURCE SCIENCES.PURPOSE: THE PRIMARY GOAL OF FAEIS IS TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN A NATIONAL REPOSITORY OF HIGHER EDUCATION DATA FROM NEARLY 200 HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS WITH DEPARTMENTS AND COLLEGES FOCUSED ON AGRICULTURE AND RELATED SCIENCES. THESE DATA INCLUDE STUDENT ENROLLMENT, DEGREES AWARDED, PLACEMENT, AND FACULTY COUNTS AND SALARIES. FAEIS DATA ARE UNIQUE, BEING DISAGGREGATED BY GENDER, ETHNICITY AND MAJOR-- CLASSIFICATION OF INSTRUCTIONAL PROGRAMS (CIP CODES). IN ADDITION, THE FAEIS TEAM STRIVES TO MAKE THIS NATIONAL REPOSITORY ACCESSIBLE AND RELEVANT TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC, ACADEMIC DEANS, USDA-NIFA, AND STAKEHOLDER ORGANIZATIONS.AUDIENCE:FAEIS OFFERS AN ACCESSIBLE RESOURCE OF EDUCATIONAL DATA FOR USERS WHICH INCLUDE HIGHER EDUCATION ADMINISTRATORS, GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, FACULTY, INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO STRENGTHEN HIGHER EDUCATION PROGRAMS. FAEIS CAN ASSIST USERS IN EXAMINING STUDENT ENROLLMENT TRENDS, DEGREES AWARDED, EMERGING DISCIPLINES, STUDENT PLACEMENT, INSTITUTIONAL COMPARISONS AND FACULTY SALARIES.METHODS:HIGHER EDUCATION DATA ARE COLLECTED THROUGH ONLINE SURVEYS WHICH ARE COMPLETED BY STAFF AND FACULTY AT HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS AT THE DEPARTMENT, COLLEGE, AND INSTITUTIONAL LEVELS. THESE DATA ARE VERIFIED BY THE FAEIS TEAM TO ENSURE ACCURATE AND CONSISTENT DATA HAS BEEN ENTERED INTO THE FAEIS DATABASE. THE FAEIS HELP DESK TEAM WORKS WITH HIGHER EDUCATION STAFF AND FACULTY TO ENTER IN DATA AND FILL IN MISSING DATA.

THE WORLD'S COMPLEX NUTRITION CHALLENGES DEMAND PREVENTION EFFORTS THAT START EARLY IN LIFE ANDTARGET THOSE MOST AT-RISK; ARE MULTI-SECTORAL, MULTI-LEVEL, AND EVIDENCE-BASED; AND, USE RIGOROUSDESIGN AND EVALUATION PROCEDURES. THIS PROPOSAL UTILIZES A COMMUNITY-ENGAGED, SYSTEMS APPROACHTO TRAIN NNF DOCTORAL FELLOWS, COMBINING REAL-WORLD LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, THOUGHTFULCOURSEWORK, AND INNOVATIVE TECHNIQUES AND APPROACHES THAT ARE REQUIRED TO REVERSE THE CHILDHOODOBESITY EPIDEMIC. WE EXPECT GRADUATING FELLOWS TO PURSUE CAREERS ACROSS SECTORS AND DRIVE SOCIALCHANGE. OUR FRIEDMAN SCHOOL RESEARCH GROUP IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO DELIVER THIS KIND OFEDUCATION AND TRAINING; EVIDENCED BY THE DEPTH AND BREADTH OF OUR CURRICULA; MENTORING EXPERIENCE;FACULTY AND GRADUATES' IMPACT, INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH; CROSS-SECTOR SYSTEMS THINKING; ANDEXPERTISE TO DEVELOP, PILOT, AND SCALE EQUITABLE EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTION STRATEGIES FOR SUPPORTINGHEALTHY LIFESTYLES. INFORMED BY THE BROADENING EXPERIENCES IN SCIENTIFIC TRAINING MODEL, WE WILL 1)RECRUIT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED CADRE OF DOCTORAL CANDIDATES WITH STRONG RESEARCH AND LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL,WITH ACTIVE OUTREACH TO PROGRAMS SERVING HISTORICALLY DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS; 2) TRAIN FELLOWSTHROUGH INTERDISCIPLINARY COURSEWORK AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING, INCLUDING SYSTEMS APPROACHESAND BEHAVIORAL SCIENCE; 3) PROVIDE MENTORSHIP, CAREER AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND CROSSSCHOOLAND UNIVERSITY COLLABORATIONS; 4) EVALUATE PROGRESS AND ACHIEVEMENTS USING OBJECTIVEPERFORMANCE MEASURES; 5) POSITION FELLOWS TO MAKE LASTING IMPACT THROUGH SCHOLARSHIP, POLICYINFLUENCE, AND COMMUNITY TRANSFORMATION. WE ANTICIPATE TWO FELLOWS WILL BEGIN TRAINING IN SEPTEMBER 2018 AND THE REMAINING IN SEPTEMBER 2019. THISFELLOWSHIP WILL PRODUCE ACCOMPLISHED, DIVERSE, FUTURE WORLD-CLASS LEADERS IN THE HUMANNUTRITION TESA, EQUIPPED WITH CRITICAL-THINKING AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS NECESSARY TOADVANCE RESEARCH AND SCIENCE-BASED PROGRAMS AT THE NATIONAL LEVEL.

GOAL: TO SUPPORT THREE NAVAJO PH.D. STUDENTS, INCREASE THE NUMBER, QUALITY, AND DIVERSITY OF GRADUATES IN AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES, AND DEVELOP LEADERSHIP SKILLS, AND SCIENCE COMPETENCIES THROUGH LOCAL TO GLOBAL EXPERIENTIAL EDUCATIONAL INTERNSHIPS.RELEVANCE: NIFA SEEKS TO ADVANCE AMERICA'S ABILITY TO ACHIEVE GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY THROUGH RESEARCH-BASED KNOWLEDGE IN AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, AND RANGE SYSTEMS THROUGH A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE WORK FORCE. HOWEVER, NATIVE AMERICANS REMAIN GROSSLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN AMERICAN AGRICULTURAL CAREERS. LESS THAN 1% OF NATIVE AMERICAN ADULTS GRADUATE WITH A FOUR-YEAR DEGREE.METHODS: TO ADDRESS THIS DISPARITY, UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA AND NAVAJO TECHNICAL UNIVERSITY ARE PARTNERING TO RECRUIT THREE NAVAJO FELLOWS TO EARN A PH.D. IN AGRICULTURAL LEADERSHIP, EDUCATION, AND COMMUNICATION AT UGA. THE CURRICULUM IS BASED ON DIN&EACUTE; CULTURAL PRINCIPLES OF NITS&AACUTE;H&AACUTE;KEES (THINKING), NAH&AACUTE;T&AACUTE; (PLANNING), I&IACUTE;NA (EXECUTION), SIIHASIN (REFLECTION). FELLOWS WILL PARTICIPATE IN A SUMMER BRIDGE PROGRAM; LOCAL INTERNSHIP WITH NAVAJO NATION COUNCIL AND USDA-APHIS SERVING NAVAJO NATION; COMPLETE 36 HOURS OF COURSE WORK AND 9 HOURS OF DISSERTATION RESEARCH; AND PARTICIPATE IN A GLOBAL INTERNSHIP WITH INTERNATIONAL FERTILIZER DEVELOPMENT CENTER IN AFRICA. FACULTY MENTORS WILL GUILD FELLOWS TOWARD RESEARCH RELATED TO LOCAL AND GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY CHALLENGES AND PREPARE THEM FOR CAREERS WITHIN THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRIES.OUTCOMES: THREE NAVAJO PH.D. HOLDERS WILL OBTAIN POSITIONS AS HIGHER EDUCATION FACULTY, USDA SCIENTISTS, NAVAJO NATION COUNCIL MEMBERS, COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND SERVE AS ROLE MODELS FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF AGRICULTURAL PROFESSIONALS.

THIS IS A PROPOSAL TO ESTABLISH AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING PROGRAM THAT TEACHES PHD STUDENTS TO ANALYZE FOREST RESOURCES FROM A CRITICAL ZONE (CZ) PERSPECTIVE. EARTH'S CZ IS THE THIN NEAR-SURFACE ZONE SPANNING FROM BEDROCK TO THE ATMOSPHERIC BOUNDARY LAYER. SINCE THE MID-2000S, SCIENTISTS HAVE BEEN VIEWING THIS ZONE THROUGH A NEW INTERDISCIPLINARY LENS THAT BRINGS TOGETHER BIOLOGY, SOIL SCIENCE, GEOLOGY, HYDROLOGY, AND METEOROLOGY TO MAKE CO-LOCATED MEASUREMENTS OF CHEMICAL AND BIOLOGICAL TRANSPORT AND TRANSFORMATION THAT DESCRIBE PAST LANDSCAPE EVOLUTION AND IMPROVE PROJECTIONS OF FUTURE CONDITIONS. THIS INTERDISCIPLINARY APPROACH HAS PRECIPITATED IMPORTANT INSIGHTS THAT LINK HYDROLOGY, WEATHERING RATES, SOIL CHARACTERISTICS, NUTRIENT AVAILABILITY, MICROBIAL PROCESS, AND PLANT DYNAMICS.THE GOALS OF OUR PROGRAM ARETO TRAIN THREE PHD GRADUATES THAT ARE LEADERS IN CRITICAL ZONE (CZ) MANAGEMENT AND DIVERSIFY THE WORKFORCE. THREE PHD FELLOWS WILL MATRICULATE INTO ONE OF THREE DEGREE PROGRAMS (ECOLOGY, SOIL SCIENCE OR FOREST RESOURCES), AND ADD COURSEWORK AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN THE FOLLOWING CORE COMPETENCY AREAS: FORESTRY, HYDROLOGY, SOIL SCIENCE, ECOLOGY, GEOSCIENCE, SYSTEMS THINKING, AND LEADERSHIP.FELLOWS WILL BE EMBEDDED WITHIN THE SUSQUEHANNA-SHALE HILLS CZ OBSERVATORY COMMUNITY, AMPLIFYING OUR IMPACT AND BROADENING EXPOSURE TO CZ SCIENCE. TRAINEES WILL COMPLETE THE FIRST-EVER CZ MANAGEMENT PLAN AND DISSEMINATE THAT PLAN BRAODLY TOINCREASETHE APPLICATION OF CZ SCIENCE FOR FOREST MANAGEMENT.

MANAGING RESILIENT AGROECOSYSTEMS WITH A DIVERSE AND ADAPTABLE WORKFORCE IS THE MAJOR PART OF THE USDA'S STRATEGIC GOALS. HOWEVER, NATIVE AMERICAN STUDENTS ARE LESS THAN 0.4% OF ALL CURRENT GRADUATE STUDENTS IN SCIENCE IN THE U.S. THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO PRODUCE THE NEXT GENERATION OF NATIVE AMERICAN LEADERS WITH ADAPTIVE CAPACITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND AS LEADERS FOR MANAGING RESILIENT FOREST AGROECOSYSTEMS. MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES ARE: 1) TO BUILD AN INNOVATIVE INTERDISCIPLINARY CURRICULUM WITH COMBINED EXPERIENTIAL TRAINING OF FOREST SCIENCE, INDIGENOUS LEADERSHIP AND SCIENCE COMMUNICATION; 2) TO TRAIN TWO MASTER'S-LEVEL NATIVE AMERICAN GRADUATE FELLOWS; 3) TO CONTINUE EXPANDING NATIVE AMERICAN REPRESENTATION IN FORESTRY GRADUATE EDUCATION. THE TRAINING WILL INCLUDE COURSEWORK IN FOREST SCIENCE, INDIGENOUS LEADERSHIP, MULTICULTURAL/GLOBAL PERSPECTIVES, SCIENCE COMMUNICATION AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING ACTIVITIES FOR SCIENCE CO-PRODUCTION, EXTENSION, TEACHING AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. FELLOWS WILL SHADOW FORESTRY PROFESSIONALS IN THE WORKPLACE; SHADOWING OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE PROVIDED BY FEDERAL, STATE AND TRIBAL FORESTRY/NATURAL RESOURCE AGENCIES. FELLOWS WILL ALSO PROVIDE COMMUNITY SERVICES AND MENTORING TO UNDERGRADUATES AND COLLEGE-READY NATIVE AMERICAN STUDENTS. FELLOWS WILL BE RECRUITED THROUGH NETWORKS OF TRIBAL PROFESSIONALS AND SELECTED FOR THEIR LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL AND LIVED EXPERIENCES. TWO FELLOWS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE PROGRAM AS A COHORT. EACH FELLOW WILL DEVELOP A GRADUATE CAREER DEVELOPMENT PLAN WITH HIS/HER ACADEMIC AND PROFESSIONAL MENTORS. PROFESSIONAL CAREERS OF THE FELLOWS AND THEIR IMPACTS WILL BE TRACKED THROUGH PERSONAL CONTACTS AND SOCIAL MEDIA, WHICH WE EXPECT TO CONTINUE STRENGTHENING NATIVE COMMUNITIES IN TESAS NATIONALLY.

EXPONENTIAL POPULATION GROWTH, CLIMATE CHANGE AND ANTICIPATED GROWTH IN PER CAPITA ANIMAL-SOURCE FOOD CONSUMPTION RELATED TO INCREASING INCOME AND URBANIZATION REPRESENT MAJOR CHALLENGES IN MAINTAINING THE FOOD SUPPLY. ANIMAL GENOMICS SHOULD PLAY A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN ADDRESSING THESE CHALLENGES BY PROVIDING NEW SOLUTIONS TO SUSTAINABLY INCREASE PRODUCTIVITY AND EFFICIENCY. TO FULFILL THIS PROMISE, A NEW GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS FAMILIAR WITH GENOMIC TECHNOLOGIES AND TRAINED TO INTEGRATE THE TOOLS OF MOLECULAR AND QUANTITATIVE GENETICS, COMPUTATIONAL BIOLOGY AND STATISTICS ACROSS MAJOR DISCIPLINES IN ANIMAL SCIENCE IS NEEDED. IN THIS PROJECT WE WILL DEVELOPE A NEW DOMESTIC ANIMAL GENOMICS INTERDISCIPLINARY CONCENTRATION IN THE ANIMAL SCIENCES TO TRAIN PRE-DOCTORAL STUDENTS IN THE NATIONAL TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA OF ANIMAL PRODUCTION WITH EMPHASIS ON INTEGRATED FIELDS OF QUANTITATIVE GENETICS, COMPUTATIONAL BIOLOGY, ANIMAL BREEDING AND STATISTICS. WE WILL RECRUIT AND TRAIN THREE PH.D. FELLOWS IN THE ANIMAL SCIENCE ACADEMIC PROGRAM. A CORE GROUP OF ANIMAL SCIENCES FACULTIES WITH HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL AND COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE EXTENSIVE AND INTEGRATIVE MENTORING AND TRAINING FOR GRADUATE STUDENTS. FELLOWS FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS WILL BE INTENSIVELY RECRUITED USING NEW AND ESTABLISHED STRATEGIES. THE PROGRAM HAS THE ADVANTAGE OF NOT ONLY PREPARING STUDENTS TO EXCEL AS GENETICISTS BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY TO HAVE THE DEPTH OF KNOWLEDGE OF ANIMAL PRODUCTION SYSTEMS. THIS WILL ENSURE THEIR RESEARCH IS FOCUSED ON OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE AGRICULTURE. EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON EXCELLENT RESEARCH TRAINING INCLUDING REGULAR RESEARCH MEETINGS, STUDENT AND FACULTY SEMINAR SERIES, INTERNSHIPS WITH MAJOR ORGANIZATIONS, HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES OR OTHER UNIVERSITIES.

CHRONIC DISEASE IS AT EPIDEMIC PROPORTIONS AND PRECISION NUTRITION REPRESENTS AN OPPORTUNITY TO UNDERSTAND COMPLEX MECHANISMS UNDERLYING HEALTH AND DISEASE AND TO FORMULATE PERSONALIZED PREVENTION AND TREATMENT REGIMES. OUR MULTIDISCIPLINARY TRAINING PROVIDES COURSES AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING THAT ADDRESSES CORE COMPETENCIES IMPORTANT IN THE ESTABLISHMENT OF RESEARCH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS TARGETING PRECISION NUTRITION. DEVELOPMENT OF HUMAN CAPITAL AND ADDITION TO THE LABOR FORCE OF INDIVIDUALS WHO CONDUCT INNOVATIVE AND CROSS-DISCIPLINARY RESEARCH, CONTRIBUTE TO PUBLIC EDUCATION AND ADVANCE SCIENCE, AND THEREBY REDUCE THE BURDEN OF CHRONIC DISEASES.

NEXT GENERATION TECHNOLOGIES IN FOOD SCIENCE ENABLE ADVANCES IN IMPROVING THE SAFETY, QUALITY, AND SECURITY OF OUR FOOD SUPPLY. YET, MISINFORMATION PROMOTED BY THE MEDIA COMBINED WITH THE INABILITY OF MOST SCIENTISTS TO EFFECTIVELY COMMUNICATE THEIR SCIENCE TO THE PUBLIC HAS RESULTED IN A WIDESPREAD PUBLIC DISTRUST OF THE FOOD INDUSTRY PREVENTING ACCEPTANCE AND ADOPTION OF MANY NEW TECHNOLOGIES. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING OF EMERGING FOOD TECHNOLOGIES BY TRAINING THREE PH.D. FOOD SCIENTISTS TO BECOME EXPERTS IN NOVEL FOOD TECHNOLOGIES AND SCIENCE COMMUNICATION. MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES TO MEET THIS GOAL INCLUDE1) DEVELOPMENT OF A TRANSDISCIPLINARY, EXPERIENTIAL CURRICULUM INCLUDING SCIENCE COMMUNICATION COURSEWORK, 2) RESEARCH IN ADVANCED FOOD TECHNOLOGIES TO TRAIN HIGHLY QUALIFIED SCIENTISTS, AND3) RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF EXCEPTIONAL STUDENTS OF UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS. THIS PROGRAM ADDRESSES THE TESA: FOOD SCIENCE, HUMAN SCIENCES, ANDHUMAN NUTRITION, IN THE DISCIPLINE: FOOD SCIENCE/TECHNOLOGY/MANUFACTURING/SAFETY (CODE F). ENGAGEMENT WITH THE DEPARTMENT'S ADVISORY COUNCIL AND INDUSTRY PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM, PARTICIPATION IN STEM OUTREACH, AND ESTABLISHMENT OF MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS WITH SCIENCE WRITERS ARE AMONG THE PLANS TO ACCOMPLISH PROJECT GOALS WITHIN THE FIVE YEAR PROJECT. TRAINING FOOD SCIENTISTS TO EFFECTIVELY COMMUNICATE WITH THE MODERN PUBLIC THROUGHOUT THEIR CAREERS HAS HIGH RELEVANCE TO NIFA GOALS AS OUTLINED IN THE STRATEGIC PLAN TO "ADVANCE AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH...TO SOLVE SOCIETAL CHALLENGES", SPECIFICALLY INTEGRATING THE "SCIENCE" AND "COMMUNICATION" GOALS OF THE REE ACTION PLAN. THIS PROGRAM WILL HAVE SIGNIFICANT NATIONAL IMPACT BY HELPING OVERCOME FUNDAMENTAL LIMITATIONS IN IMPROVING PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING AND ACCEPTANCE OF NEW FOOD TECHNOLOGIES.

OUR FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE 6 FELLOWS THE ABILITY TO COMPLETE A MASTER OF FOREST RESOURCES IN FOREST BUSINESS MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN A DISCIPLINE RELEVANT TO THE USDA MISSION. THE PROGRAM ADDRESSES NIFA STRATEGIC GOALS 1, 2 AND 4 AND USDA GOALS 1, 2, 3, AND 5. THE ANTICIPATED NATIONAL IMPACT IS THE DEVELOPMENT OF OUTSTANDING LEADERS WHO CAN PIPELINE INTO SUCCESSFUL CAREERS IN FOREST BUSINESS, ECONOMICS, PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT, WHICH WILL EXPAND THE INTELLECTUAL CAPITAL OF THE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES WORKFORCE IN AN AREA EXPERIENCING DRAMATIC SHORTAGES AND HELP REVERSE ECONOMIC DECLINE AND ENVIRONMENTAL DEGRADATION OF TRIBAL FORESTS. OUR RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE INTERTRIBAL TIMBER COUNCIL, TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, AND UNIVERSITIES ENABLE US TO RECRUIT OUTSTANDING FELLOWS TO THE PROGRAM. OUR GOAL IS TO FOSTER FELLOWS' CORE COMPETENCIES IN FOREST RESOURCE MANAGEMENT DECISION SCIENCES WITH A FOCUS ON FOREST BUSINESS, ECONOMICS AND POLICIES INFLUENCED BY BOTH FINANCIAL AND CLIMATE CHANGE UNCERTAINTIES. WE ENVISION THAT FELLOWS WILL BECOME PREEMINENT LEADERS IN A GLOBAL AND TECHNOLOGY-DRIVEN WORLD ECONOMY. THE MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES INCLUDE 100% GRADUATION SUCCESS, 0% UNABLE TO CONTACT RATE WITHIN 5 YEARS OF GRADUATION, AND SUCCESSFUL PERFORMANCE IN THE UNIQUE ASPECTS OF THE PROPOSAL, WHICH INCLUDE: (A) ENGAGEMENT IN LEADERSHIP TRAINING, (B) DEVELOPMENT OF EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING RELATIONSHIPS WITH MAJOR LAND AND TRIBAL FORESTRY MANAGEMENT ORGANIZATIONS, (C) ENHANCING KNOWLEDGE OF NATIVE AMERICAN ISSUES, (D) IMMERSION IN OUTREACH AND EXTENSION EFFORTS, AND (E) DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIVE AMERICAN FORESTRY SEMINAR FOR FOREST BUSINESS, ECONOMICS, PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT PROFESSIONALS AT NATIONAL CONFERENCES.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP AN INTERDISCIPLINARY GRADUATE TRAINING PROGRAM IN NUTRITION AND THE GUT-BRAIN AXIS TO FILL THE CURRENT KNOWLEDGE GAP IN THE WORKFORCE. THE OBJECTIVES ARE TO 1) EDUCATE SEVEN DIVERSE FELLOWS (3 FUNDED BY USDA-NNF AND 4 BY MATCHING FUNDS) IN AN INTERDISCIPLINARY AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM OF STUDY; AND 2) INVESTIGATE RESEARCH QUESTIONS INFORMED BY FACULTY AND PARTNERS TO DEVELOP NEW OR VALIDATE AND BRING TO SCALE EXISTING PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON FACTORS THAT INFLUENCE DEVELOPMENT AND HEALTHY AGING IN THE AREA OF NUTRITION AND THE GUT-BRAIN AXIS. THIS PROPOSED DOCTORAL TRAINING PROGRAM INVOLVES 13 INTERDISCIPLINARY FACULTY MEMBERS FROM THREE EXPERTISE AREAS: BRAIN DEVELOPMENT AND AGING, THE GUT MICROBIOME, AND THE GASTROINTESTINAL SYSTEM. FELLOWS WILL HAVE AT LEAST TWO ADVISORS FROM DIFFERENT EXPERTISE AREAS, TAKE COURSES IN ALL THREE AREAS, TAKE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT CLASSES, AND CONDUCT AT LEAST ONE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING EVENT OUTSIDE THE UNIVERSITY. GRADUATES OF THIS PROGRAM WILL BE UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO TAKE LEADERSHIP ROLES IN INDUSTRY, ACADEMIA AND GOVERNMENT TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES IN HUMAN HEALTH AND NUTRITION BY PROVIDING EXPERTISE IN NUTRITION AND THE GUT-BRAIN AXIS-BASED INTERDISCIPLINARY APPROACHES WITH A STRONG FOUNDATION OF PROFESSIONAL SKILLS. THIS PROJECT IS RELEVANT TO USDA-NNF BECAUSE THIS COST EFFECTIVE TRAINING PROGRAM SEEKS TO ADVANCE SOLUTIONS TO SOCIETAL ISSUES INVOLVING HUMAN HEALTH SUCH AS DEVELOPMENT, HEALTHY AGING, OBESITY, AND INFLAMMATORY RELATED DISEASES.

GLOBAL POPULATION GROWTH AND THE ESSENTIAL NEED TO INCREASE FOOD SUPPLY REQUIRES SCIENTIFIC ADVANCES AND HIGHLY SKILLED RESEARCHERS. THIS FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES NATIONAL NEEDS GRADUATE FELLOWSHIP (NNF) PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA (TESA) IN ANIMAL PRODUCTION WITH A FOCUS ON THE ANIMAL SCIENCE (CODE A) DISCIPLINE. THE OBJECTIVE HERE IS FOR A GROUP OF 17 FACULTY MEMBERS TO CONDUCT AN INNOVATIVE MULTIDISCIPLINARY GRADUATE TRAINING PROGRAM THAT FOCUSES ON REPRODUCTION, GENETICS, GENOMICS AND BIOINFORMATICS. ASPIRATIONAL GOALS ARE TO: 1) RECRUIT AND SELECT FOUR OUTSTANDING STUDENTS WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON MULTICULTURAL DIVERSITY; 2) CAREFULLY MENTOR AND EDUCATE THE FELLOWS (TWO MS AND TWO PHD); AND 3) ASSIST FELLOWS IN OBTAINING A POSITION IN ANIMAL SCIENCES THAT CONTRIBUTES TO SHORTAGE AREAS IN FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES. THE CHALLENGING MULTIDISCIPLINARY TRAINING PROGRAM PROVIDES: SIGNIFICANT RESEARCH, TEACHING AND EXTENSION OPPORTUNITIES; EMPHASIZES NEW TECHNOLOGIES ETHICS, LEADERSHIP, AND MENTORING; DEVELOPS CRITICAL THINKING AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS; AND UTILIZES MEASURABLE TARGETS TO ENSURE TRAINING SUCCESS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE AN INCREASE IN MULTICULTURAL DIVERSITY OF THE GRADUATE PROGRAM AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI AND PROVISION OF NEW SCIENTISTS AND PROFESSIONALS THAT WILL CONDUCT RESEARCH, EDUCATION, AND EXTENSION AND IMPACT FOOD AND AGRICULTURE SCIENCES. THIS INNOVATIVE MULTIDISCIPLINARY TRAINING PROGRAM IS CRITICAL TO PRODUCE SCIENTISTS WHO CAN ADDRESS AND SOLVE ONGOING AND EMERGING AGRICULTURAL CHALLENGES IN THE 21ST CENTURY.

THIS PROPOSAL HAS AN OVERALL GOAL TO DEVELOP A PROGRAM FOR DOCTORAL GRADUATE STUDENTS WITH FUNDAMENTAL KNOWLEDGE AND COMMERCIAL AND SUSTAINABILITY SKILLS TO BE LEADERS IN THE BIOPRODUCTS INDUSTRY IN ORDER TO ASSIST IN THE ECONOMICS OF A BIOREFINERY THAT PRODUCES MATERIALS AND BIOFUELS. THIS PROPOSAL SUPPORTS THE NIFA STRATEGIC GOAL OF DEVELOPING A WORLD-CLASS WORKFORCE THROUGH INNOVATIVE TALENT MANAGEMENT TARGETED AT ATTRACTING, SELECTING, ENGAGING, DEVELOPING AND RETAINING TALENTED INDIVIDUALS WITH THE RIGHT TECHNICAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS NEEDED TO MEET THE MISSION TO ADVANCE AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH, EDUCATION, AND EXTENSION TO SOLVE SOCIETAL CHALLENGES. THE PROGRAM WILL PREPARE GRADUATES (THROUGH FELLOWSHIPS AND ONE YEAR OF SUPPORT FROM NCSU) TO BE EFFECTIVE AND CREATIVE TECHNICAL PROFESSIONALS FOR THE GLOBAL FOREST BIOMATERIALS INDUSTRY. A CONCERTED EFFORT WILL BE MADE TO PARTNER WITH OUR COLLEGE DIVERSITY OFFICER TO TAP INTO THAT OFFICE'S EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS TO RECRUIT UNDER-REPRESENTED GROUPS. FELLOWS WILL BE CHOSEN BY EVALUATION OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRE SCORES, AN ESSAY DESCRIBING CAREER ASPIRATIONS, AND LETTERS OF RECOMMENDATION. CORE COURSES INCLUDE (1) WOOD CHEMISTRY, (2) FOREST BIOMATERIALS ENGINEERING, (3) MATERIAL SCIENCE OF BIOPRODUCTS, (4) SURFACE AND COLLOID SCIENCE OF BIOPRODUCTS, (5) STRATEGIC BUSINESS PROJECT PROJECT SUMMARY 2 MANAGEMENT, (6) ENVIRONMENTAL LCA, AND (7) NEW BIOPRODUCT DEVELOPMENT. THE FELLOWS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE NCSU GRADUATE SCHOOL'S PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE FOR ENHANCING COMMUNICATION, ACADEMIC, LEADERSHIP, AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS. EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING WILL INCLUDE AN INDUSTRIAL INTERNSHIP, DEVELOPMENT OF DISTANCE COURSES, AN INTERNATIONAL EXPERIENCE, AND LEADERSHIP MENTORING. INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS WILL PROVIDE INTERNSHIPS AND HELP EVALUATE THE PROGRAM AND FELLOW'S PROGRESS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO DEVELOP AN EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR A NEW GENERATION OF RESEARCHERS WHO UNDERSTAND BOTH THE AREAS OF FOREST RESOURCES AND ANIMAL PRODUCTION, AND CAN ANALYZE THIS COUPLED SYSTEM USING A LIFE CYCLE ANALYSIS APPROACH. FACULTY MEMBERS FROM THREE DEPARTMENTS (FOREST BIOMATERIALS IN COLLEGE OF NATURAL RESOURCES, ANIMAL SCIENCE IN COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURAL LIFE SCIENCE, AND STEM EDUCATION IN COLLEGE OF EDUCATION) ARE PROPOSING A JOINT DOCTORAL EDUCATION PROGRAM TO ADDRESS TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA OF FOREST RESOURCES WITH RELEVANT DISCIPLINES OF (A) ANIMAL SCIENCE, (B) BIOTECHNOLOGY, AND (C) RENEWABLE NATURALRESOURCES. DUE TO THE ELIMINATION OF CURRENT ANTIMICROBIAL GROWTH PROMOTERS IN ANIMAL FEEDS STARTING IN 2017, IT IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT TO FIND ALTERNATIVE LIVESTOCK DIETARY INTERVENTIONS THAT CAN REPLACE THE CURRENT PROMOTERS. NON-STARCH POLYSACCHARIDE (E.G. XYLOSE OLIGOSACCHARIDE FROM FOREST RESOURCES) HAS A POTENTIAL AS AN ANTIMICROBIAL GROWTH PROMOTER. FELLOWS IN THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE HANDS-ON RESEARCH EXPERIENCE IN OLIGOSACCHARIDE PRODUCTION FROM BIOMASS, QUALITY EVALUATION FOR ANIMAL FEED, AND SYSTEM EVALUATION AND ANALYSIS FROM A LIFE CYCLE PERSPECTIVE. THIS PROGRAM INCORPORATES RECRUITING UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS (SEMINARS AT HBCUS AND 2-DAY NNF RECRUITING WORKSHOP AT NCSU CAMPUS), CROSS-DISCIPLINARY TEAMWORK/ADVISING, COURSEWORK IN MULTIPLE DISCIPLINES, PREPARING FUTURE LEADERS PROGRAM IN THE CAMPUS, INTERNSHIP AT AN INDUSTRY SITE AND COMMERCIAL FARM, AND EXPOSURE TO BIOTECHNOLOGY EXPERTS IN THE INDUSTRY. THE THREE PH.D. FELLOWS FROM THIS PROGRAM WILL BE UNIQUELY PREPARED TO LEAD RESEARCH IN FOREST RESOURCES UTILIZATION WITH A STRONG INTERDISCIPLINARY APPROACH TO ANIMAL FEED PRODUCTION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE TRAINING OF THREE UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY DOCTORAL STUDENTS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH COMPREHENSIVE AND EMPOWERING LEADERSHIP AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT EXPERIENCES THAT ARE GROUNDED IN PRINCIPLES OF INTENTIONAL AND INCLUSIVE MENTORING. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, THREE DOCTORAL FELLOWS WILL HELP FILL THE SHORTAGE OF UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITIES EMPLOYED IN THE AGRICULTURAL SOCIAL SCIENCES SECTOR OF THE FOOD, AGRICULTURAL, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND HUMAN SCIENCES (FANRHS) DISCIPLINES. FELLOWS IN THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND ENHANCE PROFESSIONAL DISPOSITIONS THAT WILL BETTER PREPARE THEM FOR CAREERS AS FACULTY MEMBERS. THE INNOVATIVENESS OF THIS PROJECT LIES IN THE FELLOWS' ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN A GRADUATE TRAINING PROGRAM FOCUSED ON BUILDING EMPOWERED LEADER-SCHOLARS THROUGH INTENTIONAL MENTORING FOR INCLUSIVE EXCELLENCE IN FOOD, AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES (B.E.L.I.E.V.E). THIS PROGRAM WILL ENABLE FELLOWS TO ENGAGE IN DEVELOPMENTAL EXPERIENCES TIED TO CORE COMPETENCY AREAS RELATED TO TECHNICAL AND SCIENTIFIC ABILITY; RESEARCH AND SCHOLARSHIP; ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION; PROFESSIONAL AND CAREER DEVELOPMENT; MENTOR TRAINING; GRANT WRITING; AND DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION LEADERSHIP. ADDITIONALLY, FELLOWS WILL ENHANCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERTISE AS LEADER-SCHOLARS THROUGH THEIR ENGAGEMENT WITH THE MENTORING@PURDUE (M@P) PROGRAM IN THREE WAYS: (1) A MENTOR AND MENTEE; (2) A TEAM MEMBER WITH SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES; AND, (3) A GRADUATE RESEARCHER TO ADVANCE THE SCHOLARSHIP OF INTENTIONAL AND INCLUSIVE MENTORING. THE M@P PROGRAM USES RESEARCH-BASED EFFECTIVE MENTORING PRACTICES TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN THE NUMBER OF UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY STUDENTS IN PURDUE UNIVERSITY'S COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE WHO COMPLETE STEM-BASED AGRICULTURAL AND LIFE SCIENCE GRADUATE DEGREES AND ENTER THE STEM WORKFORCE.

OBESITY AND OBESITY-LINKED CANCERS ARE REACHING EPIDEMIC PROPORTIONS WORLDWIDE. WEIGHT LOSS, USING TRADITIONAL DIETS AND EXERCISE, HAS HIGH FAILURE RATES. RESEARCHERS AND CLINICIANS ARE SEEKING COMPLEMENTARY APPROACHES USING BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS TO MIMIC ENERGY RESTRICTION, TO REDUCE OBESITY AND OBESITY-LINKED CANCER RISK.TRAINING THE NEXT GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS, TO UTILIZE A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH TO COMBAT OBESITY AND ASSOCIATED CANCERS, IS IMPERATIVE. FELLOWS IN THIS TRAINING PROGRAM WILL LEARN TO INCORPORATE FOOD ENGINEERING PRINCIPLES TO MANIPULATE THE DIET TO INFLUENCE WHOLE BODY PHYSIOLOGY, ENERGY METABOLISM AND METABOLOMICS.THREE DOCTORAL STUDENT FELLOWS WILL LEARN AND UTILIZE STATE-OF-THE-ART APPROACHES TO ADDRESS THE OBESITY-CANCER QUESTION. THROUGH CLASSROOM, EXPERIENTIAL AND PROFESSIONAL TRAINING, FELLOWS WILL DEVELOP SKILLS NEEDED FOR SUCCESS IN THE CHANGING WORKPLACES IN ACADEMIA, GOVERNMENT AND INDUSTRY. SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY THE AWARDING OF DEGREES, QUALITY OF DISSEMINATION OF RESEARCH AS WELL AS PLACEMENT AND FOLLOW-UP TRACKING OF FELLOWS INTO THE COMPETITIVE OUTLETS FOR SCIENCE IN ACADEMIA, GOVERNMENT AND/OR INDUSTRY. IN THIS PROPOSAL, WE ADDRESS THE FOOD SCIENCE, HUMAN SCIENCES AND HUMAN NUTRITION TESA AND ADDRESS CODE F (FOOD SCIENCE/TECHNOLOGY/MANUFACTURING/SAFETY) AND CODE N (HUMAN NUTRITION). WE REQUEST FUNDS FOR SUPPORTING 3 FELLOWS IN CATEGORY 2: DOCTORAL LEVEL TRAINING.

THE GOALS OF THE TRAINING PROGRAM IN NUTRITION AND CHILDHOOD OBESITY ARE TO PROVIDE SKILL DEVELOPMENT SO THAT FELLOWS CAN EXCEL AS RESEARCHERS, INNOVATORS, PROBLEM-SOLVERS, TEACHERS AND LEADERS. THREE IN-DEPTH LEARNING EXPERIENCES ARE DESIGNED, WITH THE IMMEDIATE GOALS OF BROADENING THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE ISSUES RELATED TO CHILDHOOD OBESITY DEVELOPMENT AND PREVENTION, AND TO INFLUENCE THE DIRECTION OF THEIR DISSERTATION RESEARCH SO THAT IT IS FOCUSED ON AN AREA RELATED TO CHILDHOOD OBESITY. THE THREE UNIQUE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING ACTIVITIES ARE: 1) A COMMUNITY HEALTH ROTATION IN THE UC DAVIS CENTER FOR NUTRITION IN SCHOOLS (CNS), A STATEWIDE INITIATIVE TO IMPROVE NUTRITION IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN CALIFORNIA; 2) A ROTATION WITH THE UC DAVIS IMAGING RESEARCH CENTER, WHERE THE FELLOW WILL BECAUSE CERTIFIED TO SAFELY CONDUCT FMRI; 3) A RESEARCH ROTATION AT THE UC DAVIS RAGLE HUMAN NUTRITION RESEARCH CENTER OR THE USDA WESTERN HUMAN NUTRITION RESEARCH CENTER, WITH AN FOCUS ON VASCULAR FUNCTION, METABOLISM AND CHRONIC DISEASES WITH AN ORIGIN IN CHILDHOOD.

THERE IS A GREAT NEED TO TRAIN A NEW GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS WHO CAN ADDRESS COMPLEX, MULTIDISCIPLINARY PROBLEMS AND COMMUNICATE EFFECTIVELY WITH PRACTITIONERS, POLICYMAKERS, INDUSTRY AND THE BROADER PUBLIC. WE ARE PROPOSING AN INNOVATIVE FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM THAT INTEGRATES PRACTICAL INTERDISCIPLINARITY INTO THE TRAINING OF FUTURE ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS. OUR GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT ARE TO 1) SUPPORT THREE PHD FELLOWS, 2) TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN A DIVERSE COHORT OF FELLOWS, 3) TO TRAIN THREE GRADUATES WHO WILL BE FUTURE LEADERS IN ADDRESSING KEY NATURAL RESOURCE PROBLEMS WITH INTELLECTUAL RIGOR, CUTTING EDGE METHODS, AND INTERDISCIPLINARY APPROACHES, AND 4) TO APPLY THE LESSONS LEARNED THROUGH THIS PROGRAM TO BENEFIT ALL GRADUATE STUDENTS IN OUR DEPARTMENT. TO ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS, WE HAVE DEVISED A NEW APPROACH TO DOCTORAL TRAINING. KEY ELEMENTS OF THIS APPROACH INCLUDE 1) A HOLISTIC RECRUITING APPROACH AND NOVEL PROGRAMMATIC STRUCTURES TO AID IN RECRUITING AND RETAINING A DIVERSE AND TALENTED COHORT OF FELLOWS, 2) MANDATORY INTERDISCIPLINARY CO-ADVISING AND SEMINAR TO PROVIDE EXPLICIT TRAINING IN APPLYING DIVERSE TOOLS TO ADDRESS COMPLEX NATURAL RESOURCE PROBLEMS, AND 3) REQUIRED NON-ACADEMIC MENTORING/INTERNSHIP TO TRAIN FELLOWS TO ENGAGE EFFECTIVELY WITH PRACTITIONERS AND POLICYMAKERS.

THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES CURRENT EMERGING ISSUES IN THE DISCIPLINE OF ANIMAL SCIENCE (CODE A) AND TARGETS THE EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA IN ANIMAL PRODUCTION. THE OVERALL GOAL IS TO PROMOTE DOCTORAL LEVEL TRAINING OF NEXT GENERATION ANIMAL SCIENTISTS IN GENE EDITING THROUGH A MULTIDISCIPLINARY GRADUATE GROUP BY PROVIDING INNOVATIVE OPPORTUNITIES TO ENHANCE RESEARCH AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS. SUPPORTING OBJECTIVES ARE TO: 1) PROVIDE AWARD SUPPORT FOR THREE OUTSTANDING DOCTORAL STUDENTS, ESPECIALLY ENCOURAGING UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITIES; 2) PROVIDE CUTTING-EDGE ACADEMIC AND RESEARCH TRAINING THROUGH HIGH QUALITY MENTORS WHICH WILL ENABLE STUDENTS TO ASSUME PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS IN A VARIETY OF SETTINGS; 3) PROMOTE DEVELOPMENT OF FUTURE LEADERS IN THE ANIMAL GENE EDITING FIELD THROUGH OPPORTUNITIES FOR EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING AND EXPOSURE TO INTER-DISCIPLINARY RESEARCH. PLANS TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS WILL BUILD ON EXISTING STRENGTHS OF THE UC DAVIS GRADUATE GROUP IN ANIMAL BIOLOGY AND DISTINGUISH THESE STUDENTS AS UNIQUELY TRAINED. STUDENTS WILL COMPLETE TWO DISCIPLINES OF EMPHASIS, INCLUDING INTER-DISCIPLINARY COURSEWORK. THEY WILL COMPLETE ETHICS TRAINING. THE TRAINING PROGRAM WILL ENCOURAGE AND FACILITATE PARTICIPATION IN EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING THROUGH UNIQUE OPPORTUNITIES SUCH AS BIOTECHNOLOGY INTERNS. THIS PROGRAM PROJECT IS DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO NNF AND USDA CSREES STRATEGIC GOALS. THE ANTICIPATED IMPACT WILL BE STUDENTS WITH ENHANCED PROFESSIONAL EXPERTISE AND PREPARATION TO ASSUME POSITIONS OF LEADERSHIP TO ADDRESS CRITICAL SOCIETAL ISSUES.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES IRTA SUPPORT FOR TWO CURRENT, ELIGIBLE, DOCTORAL FELLOWS IN OUR NNF PROGRAM. ONE FELLOW WILL TRAVEL TO BRISBANE, AUSTRALIA TO COLLABORATE WITH SCIENTISTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF QUEENSLAND. THE RESEARCH GOAL IS TO CHARACTERIZE THE GENETIC BASIS FOR LONGEVITY OF BEEF COWS. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVE IS TO APPLY BAYESIAN APPROACHES TO IDENTIFY REGIONS OF THE GENOME ASSOCIATED WITH BEEF COW LONGEVITY USING PHENOTYPES AND GENOTYPES COLLECTED FROM HERDS BELONGING TO NORTHERN AUSTRALIAN PASTORAL COMPANIES. THIS RESEARCH IS SIGNIFICANT TO US AGRICULTURE BECAUSE MAINTAINING A PRODUCTIVE COW IN A HERD GENERATES ECONOMIC RETURNS OF $118 TO $244 PER COW FOR EACH ADDITIONAL YEAR OF PRODUCTIVITY.THE OTHER FELLOW WILL TRAVEL TO MILAN, ITALY TO COLLABORATE WITH SCIENTISTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MILAN. THE RESEARCH GOAL IS TO IDENTIFY THE MOLECULAR BASIS FOR EPISTATIC INTERACTIONS AMONG CATTLE COAT COLOR GENES. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVE FOR THIS IRTA IS TO MAP THE DEGREE OF WHITE SPOTTING IN AN ITALIAN DUAL-PURPOSE CATTLE BREED. THIS RESEARCH IS SIGNIFICANT TO US AGRICULTURE BECAUSE COAT COLOR IS AN IMPORTANT FACTOR IN BREED IDENTITY, AND COAT COLOR IS A MODEL SYSTEM TO DEVELOP METHODS TO CHARACTERIZE THE MOLECULAR BASIS OF EPISTATIC INTERACTIONS THAT COULD BE EXTENDED TO OTHER COMPLEX TRAITS RELEVANT TO FOOD SECURITY, ANIMAL PRODUCTION, AND HEALTH.

THE INTERDISCIPLINARY LIPID NANO SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY IS AN EMERGING AREA THAT AIMS TO IMPROVE FOOD QUALITY AND HUMAN NUTRITION, AND IT IS A TARGETED EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA (TESA). LIPIDS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS PROMISING MOLECULES DUE TO THEIR SELF-ASSEMBLY CAPABILITIES AND SPECIFICITY OF INTERACTION AND FUNCTIONALITY. HOWEVER, INDUSTRIAL APPLICATIONS HAVE LAGGED BEHIND SCIENTIFIC ADVANCES, IN LARGE PART DUE TO A CRITICAL SHORTAGE OF SCIENTISTS, ESPECIALLY YOUNG PROFESSIONALS, SPECIALIZED IN THE SYNTHESIS, CHARACTERIZATION, AND UTILIZATION OF LIPID-BASED MATERIALS. IT IS BECAUSE OF THIS URGENT NEED AND YET SHORTAGE OF THE EXPERTS THAT WE ARE PROPOSING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRUCTURED TRAINING PROGRAM TO EXPAND THE COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS REQUIRED FOR NEXT-GENERATION FOOD AND NUTRITION SCIENTISTS. WE WILL GUIDE THE PHD FELLOWS TO EXPLORE THE BIOCATALYTIC SYNTHESIS OF FUNCTIONAL LIPIDS, TO STUDY THEIR SELF-ASSEMBLY, THEIR INTERACTION WITH FOOD OR DELIVERING MATRIX ON NANO SCALES, ANDTHEIR FUNCTIONAL PROPERTIES AND APPLICATIONS. WE HAVE ASSEMBLED AN INTERDISCIPLINARY FACULTY TEAM (10 MEMBERS) ACROSS ISU CAMPUS AND FROM AARHUS UNIVERSITY (DENMARK) TO ENSURE A BROAD, HOLISTIC, AND INTEGRATED TRAINING AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT. OUR LEADERSHIP TRAINING CURRICULUM INCLUDES THEORETICAL AND PRACTICAL DAILY APPLICATIONS IN CAMPUS ACTIVITIES AND OFF-CAMPUS INTERACTIONS WITH INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES IN THE U.S. AND OVERSEAS. THE MAJOR UNIQUE FEATURE OF THIS TRAINING PROGRAM LIES IN THE MULTI-PRONGED EDUCATION, I.E., PARTNERING RESEARCH, TEACHING AND MENTORING, AND EXTENSION THAT INTERSECT THE PUBLIC, PRIVATE, ACADEMIA, AND REGULATORY SECTORS, WITH LEADERSHIP ROLES/TRAINING EMBEDDED ACROSS ALL ACTIVITIES.SPECIAL EFFORT AND STRUCTURE ARE IN PLACE FOR RECRUITING AND MENTORING FELLOWS FROM THE UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS. OUR EXISTING FACULTY CONNECTIONS AND COLLABORATIONS WITH MINORITY SCHOOLS WILL BE FULLY UTILIZED FOR SELECTING AND INVITING CANDIDATES TO CAMPUS INTERVIEW. FELLOWS FROM UNIQUE BACKGROUNDS WILL NOT ONLY BE MENTORED BY FACULTY OF COLOR THAT IS DESIGNED TO ENSURE THE ULTIMATE TRAINING SUCCESS, BUT ALSO ASSIST IN RECRUITING AND MENTORING MCNAIR SCHOLARS AND GEORGE WASHINGTON CARVER MINORITY FELLOWS. QUANTITATIVE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS MATRIX HAS BEEN DESIGNED AND WILL BE USED TO EVALUATE THE PROGRAM. EVERY EFFORT WILL BE MADE TO TIMELY COMPLETE THE TRAINING OF EACH FELLOW IN THREE YEARS, WITH EACH FELLOW PUBLISHING 2-3 PEER-REVIEWED PUBLICATIONS IN PREMIER NANO SCIENCE JOURNALS. THROUGHOUT THE TRAINING PERIOD, FREQUENT EVALUATIONS WILL BE CONDUCTED ON NOT ONLY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BUT ALSO LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT. INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT MENTORS WILL BE INVOLVED IN THE FELLOWS' PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT.WE FULLY EXPECT TO SUSTAIN THE INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING PROGRAM BEYOND THIS GRANT TO MEET THE NATIONAL NEEDS IN FOOD AND NUTRITION APPLICATIONS OF NANOTECHNOLOGY. A SUBSTANTIAL INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT OF $252,00 HAS BEEN COMMITTED TO THIS PROGRAM, ENSURING OUR SUCCESS AND ENABLING RECRUITMENT OF A 4TH STUDENT FROM THE MINORITY GROUPS.THE PROPOSED PROGRAM FALLS UNDER THE USDA-NIFA'S STRATEGIC GOALS AND OBJECTIVES AND IT ADDRESSES THREE OF THE SIX NATIONAL CHALLENGE AREAS (FOOD SECURITY, SAFETY AND OBESITY).

TODAY'S GLOBAL AGRICULTURE ECONOMY NEEDS BROADLY TRAINED PLANT HEALTH PRACTITIONERS AT THE DOCTORAL LEVEL IN ORDER TO SYNTHESIZE AND CONVEY THE LARGE QUANTITY OF COMPLEX INFORMATION GENERATED BY ONGOING AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH. THE INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING OF THE UNIVERSITY OF FLORIDA, DOCTOR OF PLANT MEDICINE (DPM) DEGREE UNIQUELY PREPARES AND EQUIPS STUDENTS FOR LEADERSHIP IN PLANT-FOCUSED AGRICULTURE BIOSECURITY. FROM AN ACADEMIC PERSPECTIVE, THE GRADUATE LEVEL CERTIFICATE IN PLANT PEST RISK ASSESSMENT AND MANAGEMENT WILL ALSO BE COMPLETED CONCURRENTLY WITH THE DPM DEGREE AS A COMPONENT OF NNF SCHOLAR TRAINING. EXPERIENTIAL AND INTERDISCIPLINARY REGULATORY PLANT HEALTH INTERNSHIPS ARE A REQUIREMENT OF THE CERTIFICATE PROGRAM. OUR PROJECT GOAL FOCUSES ON TRAINING THREE NNF DOCTORAL SCHOLARS FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS IN THE AREA OF AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON PLANT BIOSECURITY (DISCIPLINE CODE X). NO IRTAS HAVE BEEN REQUESTED FOR THE PROJECT. ASSESSMENTS WILLOCCUR DURING THE PROGRAM AND FIVE YEARS FOLLOWING NNF SCHOLAR GRADUATION. THE PROPOSED PROJECT ADDRESSES GOAL 3, 2, AND 1 OF THE USDA STRATEGIC PLAN FOR FY 2014-2018. GOAL 3 IS ADDRESSED DUE TO THE PROFESSIONALLY TRAINED DPM PROGRAM GRADUATES UNIQUELY PREPARED TO PROMOTE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND CONSEQUENTLY INCREASE FOOD AND AGRICULTURE SECURITY. THE INTENSIVE YET FLEXIBLE CURRICULUM OFFERED PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRAINING IN THE LATEST AGRICULTURAL BIOTECHNOLOGY RESOURCES. THE PROBLEM-SOLVING AND LEADERSHIP OF THESE NNF SCHOLARS WILL CRITICALLY BENEFIT FUTURE U.S. PLANT HEALTH SAFEGUARDING EFFORTS.

AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD WASTES (AFW) ARE ONE OF MOST CRITICAL ETHICAL, ECONOMIC, ENVIRONMENTAL AND GLOBAL ISSUES OF THE 20TH CENTURY. DESPITE THE URGENT NEED FOR TRAINED AFW INDIVIDUALS, THERE ARE LIMITED TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR FOOD SCIENCE STUDENTS. IN ADDITION, MORE RESEARCH NEEDS TO BE DONE TO GUIDE THE FOOD INDUSTRY ON HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES THEY FACE IN TERMS OF IMPLEMENTING ECONOMICALLY VIABLE ALTERNATIVES TO THEIR CURRENT AFW PRACTICES. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THESE ISSUES BY TRAINING GRADUATE STUDENTS WITH THE LEADERSHIP AND TECHNICAL SKILLS NEEDED TO SOLVE AFW CHALLENGES. A DEDICATED/KNOWLEDGEABLE TEAM OF 11 SCIENTISTS FROM 5 DEPARTMENTS/CENTERS/INSTITUTES AT CALIFORNIA POLYTECHNIC STATE UNIVERSITY - SAN LUIS OBISPO, WILL WORK COLLECTIVELY ON TRAINING THE STUDENTS. THE TEAM HAS COLLECTIVELY 101 YEARS OF HIGHER EDUCATION EXPERIENCE AND GRADUATED 106 GRADUATE STUDENTS. THE PROPOSED MASTER'S PROGRAM IN AFW WILL BE BUILT AROUND THE UNIQUE "LEARN-BY-DOING" FEATURE OF CAL POLY, WHICH HAS MADE ITS REPUTATION IN THE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD INDUSTRY, AND WILL ADD 5 KEY ELEMENTS: 1) TAILORED CURRICULUM FOR THE FELLOWS, 2) APPLIED RESEARCH IN THE AREA OF AFW, 3) TEACHING PRACTICUM, 4) MANDATORY INTERNSHIP WITH THE FOOD INDUSTRY FOCUSING ON AFW, 5) MENTORING OF DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS. STUDENT RESEARCH TRAINING WILL FOCUS ON MINIMIZING AND/OR CONVERTING AFW OR EXTRACTING HIGH-VALUE COMPONENTS FROM AFW. BY WORKING CLOSELY WITH THE FOOD INDUSTRY, ORGANIZING MONTHLY NETWORKING EVENTS, AND DISSEMINATE OUR FINDINGS THROUGH VARIOUS MEANS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO NEWSLETTER, SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS AND PRESENTATIONS, RESULTS OBTAINED THROUGH THIS PROGRAM WILL BE SHARED WITH THE INTERESTED AUDIENCE.THIS PROGRAM WILL GRADUATE 6 FUTURE LEADERS, INCLUDING 4 FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS, WITH THE COMMUNICATION, CRITICAL THINKING, AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS NEEDED TO EFFICIENTLY COMMUNICATE, EVALUATE, AND ADAPT THEIR THINKING IN REGARDS TO THE ISSUE OF AFW. IT WILL ALSO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACT ALL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS, WHO WILL BE INVOLVED IN THE PROJECT. AS A CONSEQUENCE, THE PROJECT WILL LEAD TO MORE TRAINED FOOD SCIENTISTS KNOWLEDGEABLE IN THE AREA OF AFW, AND SCIENTIFIC FINDINGS THAT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO A BETTER ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT OF AFW AND ULTIMATELY INCREASE PROFITS OF THE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL STAKEHOLDERS.

NEARLY 90% OF FLOWERING PLANT SPECIES AND 75% OF GLOBAL AGRICULTURAL FOOD CROPS USE ANIMAL-MEDIATED POLLINATION TO SET SEED AND PRODUCE FRUIT. THESE ANIMAL-POLLINATED CROPS, INCLUDING MOST FRUITS, VEGETABLES, AND NUTS, PROVIDE THE MAJORITY OF THE MICRONUTRIENTS AND PLANT-BASED FATS NEEDED IN HUMAN DIETS, AND THUS ARE CRITICAL PILLARS IN HUMAN NUTRITION. POLLINATION SERVICES CONTRIBUTE $25 BILLION TO THE US ECONOMY IN TERMS OF INCREASED CROP YIELD ALONE, WITH AN ADDITION $20 BILLION IN VALUE TO AGRICULTURAL-ASSOCIATED INDUSTRIAL SECTORS.HOWEVER, THERE HAVE BEEN DECLINES IN POPULATIONS OF BOTH WILD AND MANAGED POLLINATORS ACROSS THE WORLD. US BEEKEEPERS LOSE AN AVERAGE OF 30% OF THEIR MANAGED HONEY BEE COLONIES EACH WINTER, AND 25% DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS; 50% OF WILD BUMBLE BEE SPECIES ARE IN DECLINE IN THE US; AND NORTH AMERICAN MONARCH BUTTERFLY POPULATIONS HAVE DECREASED BY NEARLY 80% OVER THE LAST 20 YEARS. IT IS CRITICAL THAT WE FIND APPROACHES THAT WILL SUPPORT ABUNDANT AND DIVERSE COMMUNITIES OF POLLINATORS IN OUR AGRICULTURAL LANDS TO ENSURE ROBUST AND SUSTAINABLE POLLINATION SERVICES.TACKLING THE CHALLENGE OF POLLINATOR DECLINES AND ENSURING SUSTAINABLE, ROBUST POLLINATION ECOSYSTEMS SERVICES ACROSS A DIVERSITY OF AGRICULTURAL CROPS AND LANDSCAPES REQUIRES A HOLISTIC, TRANS-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH, THAT SEAMLESSLY INTEGRATES BASIC AND APPLIED SCIENCE WITH EXTENSION, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH. IT ALSO REQUIRES A FRAMEWORK WHERE SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH INTERFACES WITH MULTIPLE STAKEHOLDER GROUPS, INCLUDING BEEKEEPERS, LAND MANAGERS, GROWERS, INDUSTRY GROUPS AND POLICYMAKERS. WE WILL LEVERAGE THE STRENGTHS OF THE PENN STATE CENTER FOR POLLINATOR RESEARCH (CPR) AND ITS ASSOCIATED GRADUATE PROGRAMS IN ENTOMOLOGY AND ECOLOGY TO PROVIDE BROAD, INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING FOR GRADUATE STUDENTS. WE WILL WORK WITH OUR STAKEHOLDER ADVISORY BOARD TO ENSURE STUDENTS ENGAGE WITH CURRENT AND EMERGING REAL-WORLD CHALLENGES, AND LEVERAGE EXPERTISE AND INFRASTRUCTURE PROVIDED BY THESE GROUPS. STUDENTS WILL OBTAIN VALUABLE SKILLS IN COMMUNICATION AND LEADERSHIP THROUGH DIVERSE EXTENSION, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES AT THE LOCAL, REGIONAL, NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL LEVELS, SELECTING ACTIVITIES THAT FURTHER THEIR PROFESSIONAL INTERESTS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ENSURE THAT THE RESULTS OF THIS PROGRAM ARE BROADLY DISSEMINATED TO DIVERSE COMMUNITIES AND AUDIENCES.THE BROAD, TRANS-DISCIPLINARY TRAINING PROVIDED BY THIS PROGRAM WILL ENSURE THAT GRADUATING STUDENTS WILL NOT ONLY BE ABLE TO CREATIVELY AND HOLISTICALLY TACKLE ISSUES RELATED TO POLLINATORS AND POLLINATION SERVICES, BUT WILL HAVE A WEALTH OF TRANSFERRABLE SKILLS AND EXPERTISE IN SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, ALLOWING THEM TO ADDRESS A MYRIAD OF CURRENT AND EMERGING CHALLENGES IN AGRICULTURE AND CONSERVATION.

THE TARGETED EXPERTESE SHORTAGE AREA (TESA) THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES FALLS UNDER 'AGRICULTURAL MANAGEMENT AND ECONOMICS' WITH RELEVANT DISCIPLINES INCLUDING 'INTERDISCIPLINARY', 'SUSTAINABLE FOOD', 'AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES', 'SOCIAL SCIENCES' AND 'ECONOMICS GRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS'. THERE WILL BE FOUR MASTER'S LEVEL AND ONE DOCTORAL LEVEL FELLOWS RECRUITED IN THIS PROGRAM.INTEREST IN AQUAPONICS IS SOARING, BUT MOST OPERATIONS ARE SMALL-SCALE. AQUAPONICS SHOWS GREAT PROMISE TO INCREASE THE FOOD SUPPLY, BUT THERE ARE FEW PEOPLE WITH THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLSETS NECESSARY TO WORK IN AQUAPONICS, AND THERE ARE CHALLENGES TO SOLVE BEFORE INDUSTRIAL-SCALE AQUAPONICS IS VIABLE. THESE FELLOWS WILL DEVELOP CRITICAL-THINKING SKILLS HELPING TO SOLVE SOME OF THE CHALLENGES, AND WILL HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE TO WORK IN INDUSTRY. FELLOWS WILL DO HANDS-ON WORK DURING TWO SUMMERS IN AN EXPERIENTIAL BOOT CAMP AT A COMMERCIAL-SCALE AQUAPONICS SYSTEM.THEY WILL DO ACADEMIC WORK IN RELEVANT DISCIPLINES AND TAKE TEAM-TAUGHT SEMINAR COURSES.THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO GRADUATE FIVE FELLOWS WITH SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE TO ADVANCE AQUAPONICS AND PROVIDE CAPABLE WORKER FOR THE GROWING AQUAPONICS INDUSTRY.THE MEASUREABLE OBJECTIVES INCLUDE:1) EDUCATE FELLOWS ABOUT AQUAPONICS USING AN INTEGRATED, INTERDISCIPLINARY CURRICULUM;2) PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS; AND3) PREPARE FELLOWS FOR LEADERSHIP ROLES IN RESEARCH, ACADEMIA, GOVERNMENT AND INDUSTRY.THIS PROPOSAL IS RELEVANT NNF PROGRAM GOALS OF: GOAL 1 (SCIENCE), SUBGOALS 1.1, 1.3, AND 1.7; AND GOAL 3 (PROCESS)THE NATIONAL IMPACT IS THAT WE WILL EDUCATE FOUR MASTER'S AND ONE DOCTORAL STUDENT WITH THE CRITICAL THINKING AND PRACTICAL SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE TO MOVE AQUAPONICS TO THE NEXT LEVEL. THIS FIRST CADRE OF FELLOWS WILL FORM THE NUCLEUS FOR A PROFESSIONAL PROGRAM THAT WE EXPECT TO CONTINUE TO GROW AS AQUAPONICS BEGINS TO FULFILL ITS PROMISE AND BECOMES INDUSTRIAL-SCALE.

AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION IS A BROAD, APPLIED FIELD THAT DRAWS FOUNDATIONAL KNOWLEDGE FROM PSYCHOLOGY AND SOCIOLOGY, WHILE FOCUSING ON THE HUMAN DIMENSIONS OF SCIENCE AND PRACTICE IN AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT (DOERFERT, 2011, P. 5). THIS INCLUDES AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION IN SCHOOLS, UNIVERSITIES, IN BOTH FORMAL AND NON-FORMAL SETTINGS AS WELL AS UNIVERSITY PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO CREATE EDUCATORS, LEADERS, AND PROFESSIONAL COMMUNICATORS FOR THE BREADTH OF AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY. RESEARCH HAS IDENTIFIED A NEED FOR MORE, AND DIVERSIFIED, CANDIDATES IN BOTH THE POST-SECONDARY TEACHER EDUCATION RANKS OF AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION AS WELL AS IN THE SECONDARY CLASSROOM (DOERFERT, 2011; ROBERTS, HARDER & BRASHEARS, 2016). WE HAVE SECURED A COMMITMENT FROM NIFA TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO HELP US ADDRESS THE NATIONALLY IDENTIFIED SHORTAGE OF AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION TEACHERS WITH A FOCUS ON THE RECRUITMENT OF A TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED CANDIDATE. OUR FELLOW WILL CREATE A NATIONAL IMPACTAS HE/SHE TAKES FACULTY POSITIONS TO TRAIN AND SUPPORT SECONDARY TEACHERS IN AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION, EXPONENTIALLY INCREASING THEIR ABILITY TO IMPACT AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION, FURTHER SUPPORT UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY STUDENTS, AND SERVE AS MODELS FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF AGRICULTURALISTS.WE WILL RECRUIT ONE UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY FELLOW AND PROVIDE RIGOROUS CROSS-DISCIPLINARY TRAINING IN AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION WITH AN EMPHASIS IN STEM PREPARATION. OUR OVERALL PROJECT GOAL IS TO DEVELOP FACULTY WITH COMPETENCIES IN RESEARCH, TEACHER EDUCATION, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATIONAL TECHNOLOGY, SERVICE, LEADERSHIP, AND SCHOLARSHIP. THIS NIFA AWARD WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR US TO POSITIVELY IMPACT AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION AS EACH FELLOW WILL GRADUATE AND IN A TYPICAL POSITION, INFLUENCE 20-30 ASPIRING TEACHERS PER YEAR. THESE TEACHERS, WHO WILL GROW AND EXPAND IN THEIR THINKING THROUGH INTERACTION WITH DIVERSE FACULTY EDUCATORS, AND IN TURN WILL GRADUATE AND TAKE HIGH SCHOOL STEM-RELATED AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE POSITIONS, WILL INTERACT WITH 100-200 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS ON A DAILY BASIS. AFTER JUST A FEW SHORT YEARS, THE BENEFITS AND EXAMPLES SET BY A FEW UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY FACULTY CAN SHAPE AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION.
GRADUATE TRAINING AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT IN INFECTIOUS DISEASES AND AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY

THE NATIONAL NEEDS FELLOWSHIP- INTEGRATED APPROACH TO GRADUATE RESEARCH, EDUCATION, AND ENGAGEMENT (NNF-IAGREE) PROJECT AT THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS RIO GRANDE VALLEY PRESENTS A PRACTICAL AND COMPREHENSIVE FELLOWSHIP PLAN TO RECRUIT EIGHT OUTSTANDING, UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS OVER A 60-MONTH PROJECT PERIOD INTO A NEWLY DEVELOPED MASTER'S PROGRAM IN AGRICULTURAL, ENVIRONMENTAL AND SUSTAINABILITY SCIENCES. THE OVERALL PROJECT GOALS ARE TO (A) PROVIDE AN INTEGRATIVE, ACCESSIBLE, AND HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE FOR STUDENTS INTERESTED IN ADVANCED SCIENCES RELATED TO SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SYSTEMS AND (B) FACILITATE OPPORTUNITIES TO DEVELOP SKILLS IMPORTANT IN AGRICULTURAL CAREERS THROUGH ENGAGED SCHOLARSHIP, PROFESSIONAL MENTORSHIP, OUTREACH OPPORTUNITIES, AND TRAINING IN COMMUNICATION AND EXTENSION. THE MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES ARE TO PROVIDE 8 STUDENTS AN OPPORTUNITY TO: (A) COMPLETE AN INTEGRATIVE MS WITHIN THE PROJECT PERIOD; (B) PARTICIPATE IN HANDS-ON RESEARCH TRAINING IN LABORATORIES WITH CUTTING-EDGE SCIENTIFIC TECHNOLOGY AND PROTOCOLS, (C) DISSEMINATE STUDENT RESEARCH THROUGH 8 MS THESES, SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS, AND OTHER MULTIMEDIA PRODUCTS (VIDEOS) WITHIN THE PROJECT PERIOD. THIS PROJECT IS HIGHLY RELEVANT TO THE NNF PROGRAM GOALS AS IT NOT ONLY PRODUCES AND DISSEMINATES SCIENCE NEEDED TO INFORM THE SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF FOOD AND AGRICULTURE SYSTEMS BUT ALSO RESULTS IN EIGHT HIGHLY-QUALIFIED MS-LEVEL MINORITY SCIENTISTS WHO THROUGH THEIR PARTICIPATION IN RESEARCH, EDUCATION, AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES IN THE NNF-IAGREE, WILL HAVE THE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED TO SUCCESSFULLY FOMENT AND DIVERSIFY OUR NEXT GENERATION AGRICULTURAL WORKFORCE IN THE TARGET EXPERTISE SHORTAGE AREA OF INTEGRATIVE BIOSCIENCES FOR SUSTAINABLE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SYSTEMS.
FOOD MANUFACTURING AND SAFETY MENTORING PROGRAM TO DEVELOP FUTURE FOOD INDUSTRY LEADERS

THREE PHD FELLOWS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY NFF AND AU.THE GOAL/OBJECTIVE IS TO ENHANCE AQUACULTURE GENETICS AND PRODUCTION IN THE US BY OVERCOMING THE SHORTAGE OF SCIENTISTS CROSS-TRAINED IN QUANTITATIVE AND MOLECULAR GENETICS AND RELATED GENETIC BIOTECHNOLOGIES. DURING THE PAST 25 YEARS, AQUACULTURE GENOMICS EXPERIENCED TREMENDOUS ADVANCEMENT. HOWEVER, THIS RESEARCH HAD MINIMAL IMPACT ON THE US AQUACULTURE INDUSTRY. WITH THE ADVENT OF GENOME WIDE ASSOCIATED SELECTION, FIRST APPROVAL OF TRANSGENIC FISH FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION AND EMERGENCE OF POWERFUL GENE EDITING TECHNOLOGY, IT IS TIMELY TO TRANSLATE GENOMICS, MOLECULAR GENETICS AND BIOTECHNOLOGICAL APPROACHES INTO MORE RAPID GENETIC IMPROVEMENT TO INCREASE AQUACULTURE PRODUCTION TO ENSURE SAFE, HIGH QUALITY FOOD FOR CONSUMERS. THIS REQUIRES SCIENTISTS HAVING A COMBINATION OF SKILLS IN BOTH QUANTITATIVE GENETICS AND MOLECULAR GENETICS/GENOMICS. THE PAST 3 DECADES, MOST STUDENTS CHOSE MOLECULAR GENETICS AND VERY FEW QUANTITATIVE GENETICS. THE US NOW HAS A SHORTAGE OF YOUNG SCIENTISTS TRAINED IN AQUATIC QUANTITATIVE GENETICS AND ESPECIALLY THOSE COMPETENT IN A COMBINATION OF QUANTITATIVE AND MOLECULAR GENETICS AND MOLECULAR BIOTECHNOLOGY. WE PROPOSE A GRADUATE PROGRAM FOR FELLOWS UNIQUELY TRAINED IN QUANTITATIVE, FIELD AND MOLECULAR GENETICS TO ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM, HAVING INITIAL IMPACT IN 4 YEARS. THE FELLOWS WILL BE TRAINED IN AN INTEGRATED, HOLISTIC GRADUATE PROGRAM IN QUANTITATIVE GENETICS, MOLECULAR GENETICS, GENOMICS, GENE EDITING, GENETIC BIOTECHNOLOGY, STEM CELL TECHNOLOGY, BIOINFORMATICS, GENETIC DATA ANALYSIS AND REPRODUCTION (GENETIC IMPROVEMENT IS USELESS WITHOUT PRODUCTION OF ADEQUATE SEED STOCK). THIS PROJECT IS RELEVANT AS IT ADDRESSES A VOID IN US EXPERTISE IN A RELATIVELY NEW INTEGRATED FIELD WITH LITTLE AQUACULTURE EXPERTISE.
